lines.text: How do you fit into the picture, Mr. Connolly?
I work for Lou - new boy - sort of a handyman.
And where did he find you?
A sale... war surplus... big reduction.
He's not only cute - he's funny.
Part of my job. Evey hour on the hour, a joke.
Lou likes jokes. He'll like you. You're amusing, Mr. Connolly... and hard.

...I figured all the business must have gone west, and I came out to look things over... found a place out on Sunset Strip... looked good. Then i tried to get a loan. No dice. "The banks like to see a sure thing," they said. "For instance?" I said. Something certain. I said, "All right. What's certain?" Two things... death and taxes. So I got to thinking, who comes to California? There's the ones who come here to live and the ones who come here to die. I couldn't get the live ones without a nightclun - so meet Ben Arno - mortician.

[to Sgt. Pluther, who's firing a fleeing suspect]
Hold it. You're liable to hit a taxpayer.

[to Bob about Steve]
I didn't only break his back the last ten days, I broke his heart,

[after Quong closes his eyes]
Can't you help us, doc? Can't you do something?

[after opening Quong's eyelid]
I'm afraid the next time he talks it'll be to his ancestors.
